en.title: EU Blue Card Visa
en.subtitle: Start your professional journey in Europe with the Blue Card

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: The EU Blue Card is one of the most important work and residence permits in Europe, designed for highly skilled professionals from outside the EU. It allows you to legally work and live in an EU country, with the possibility to move to other countries later, making it a strategic choice for building a professional career and a stable life in the heart of Europe.

importance.title: Importance of the Blue Card
items: Addressing labor shortages in Europe: targets professionals in in-demand fields such as IT, engineering, medicine, and sciences.
Freedom of movement: after a certain period, you can move to another EU country without restarting the application process.
Family stability: simplifies and speeds up family reunification procedures.
Permanent residence opportunity: in countries like Germany, you can apply after 21โ27 months if you are proficient in the language.

countries.title: Main Countries Offering the Blue Card
items: Germany ๐ฉ๐ช: the most demanded destination due to a strong economy and diverse job opportunities.
France ๐ซ๐ท: rich environment for research, engineering, and sciences.
Spain ๐ช๐ธ: attractive option for professionals seeking a mix of work and cultural life.
countries.note: Almost all EU countries offer the Blue Card except Denmark and Ireland.

requirements.title: Basic Requirements for the Blue Card
items: Recognized university degree or equivalent professional qualification.
Employment contract or job offer from an EU employer.
Minimum annual salary (varies by country, e.g., โฌ48,300 in Germany 2025, or โฌ43,759 for shortage occupations).
Health insurance covering the entire stay.
Proof that the job is related to your academic or professional specialty.

steps.title: Obtain a job offer
steps.description: Get an employment contract from a European company or institution.

steps.title: Degree recognition
steps.description: Ensure your degree is recognized, e.g., ZAB office in Germany.

steps.title: Prepare documents
steps.description: Collect passport, photos, employment contract, academic certificate, salary proof, and health insurance.

steps.title: Submit application
steps.description: Submit the application at the embassy, consulate, or immigration office of the target country.

steps.title: Wait for decision
steps.description: Processing may take 8 weeks to several months depending on the country.

steps.title: Receive the Blue Card
steps.description: Upon approval, receive the Blue Card and start working.

documents.title: Required Documents
items: Valid passport covering the expected duration of stay.
Recent passport photos according to EU biometric standards (35ร45 mm, light background).
Recognized university degree or equivalent, recognized in the target country.
Degree recognition certificate (e.g., ZAB or ANABIN in Germany).
Experience letters or previous employment contracts.
Signed employment contract or official job offer from an EU employer.
Proof of annual salary above the minimum required.
Proof of financial capacity (employment contract or bank statement if requested).
Comprehensive health insurance from day one of stay.
Completed and signed national visa (D-Visa) application form.
Motivation letter explaining why you chose the country and the job.
Marriage or birth certificates if applying with family.
notes: All documents not in English or German must be certified translated.
Some EU countries may require additional documents like a clean criminal record or health certificate.
Provide originals and copies when submitting.
Requirements vary slightly by country, but Germany, France, and Spain are similar in basic requirements.

processingTime.title: Processing Time
processingTime.duration: The card is usually granted for 4 years or contract duration + 3 months. Processing can take several months, especially in high-demand countries like Germany.

validity.title: Card Validity
validity.duration: Usually granted for 4 years or contract duration + 3 months, with possibility of extension.

fees.title: Fees & Costs
items: National visa (D-Visa) fee: approx. โฌ75 (paid at the embassy/consulate).
Residence permit upon arrival: โฌ100โ140 for issuing the Blue Card.
Card renewal fee: โฌ80โ100 depending on extension duration.
Health insurance: mandatory for the entire stay, cost varies between โฌ100โ400/month.
Proof of financial capacity: must show annual income not less than โฌ48,300 (2025) or โฌ43,759 for shortage occupations.
Document translation and certification: โฌ200โ600 depending on the number of documents.
Passport photos and additional service fees: approx. โฌ20โ50.
notes: Fees are non-refundable even if the application is rejected.
Costs vary slightly by country, Germany is the most common destination.
The card can be extended after expiry according to approved conditions.

benefits.title: Main Benefits
items: Legal residence and work in the EU.
Freedom to move between EU countries after a stay period.
Possibility to apply for permanent residence after a certain time.

withKaya.title: What We Offer at Kaya
services: Specialized consultation to determine your eligibility for the Blue Card.
Preparing your academic and professional file according to each country's requirements.
Step-by-step follow-up until the visa is issued.
Additional support for your family in case of family reunification application.
Guidance after arrival on registration and integration into the labor market.
With Kaya, the EU Blue Card is not just a work permit but the start of a new life in the heart of Europe.
